etymology.description: abbreviated phonetic 高 + semantic 豕 (pig, boar)
etymology.interpretation: High 高 supplies the sound háo, while 豕 ‘boar’ contributes a semantic cue linked to boar bristles and vigor. Over time the sense broadened from associations of strength and prominence to ideas of grandeur, extravagance, and heroic spirit.

examples.chinese: 这家酒店很豪华(這家酒店很豪華)。
他说话很豪气(他說話很豪氣)。
examples.english: He speaks with a bold, heroic air.

examples.chinese: 他们出手大方(他們出手大方)，十分豪迈(十分豪邁)。
examples.english: They are generous and very bold-spirited.
